text: I made a commitment a long time ago that I wouldn’t vote for yet another CR that didn’t include a solution for #dreamers. My position hasn’t changed.

Today marks the 45th anniversary of Roe v. Wade. Since then, there have been numerous attempts to restrict a woman’s access to abortion. We must ensure that women everywhere can make their own choices about their health care. #RoevWade

Here is why I voted against Republicans' short-term spending bill today: http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DULl8VZXkAAgCCy.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/955578404509798401/vid/240x240/gn1aD-BXxOocOtwc.mp4

Republicans, who control the White House, Senate, and House, have a duty to govern responsibly. Pitting our most vulnerable against one another is no way to govern. Neither is passing another short-term funding bill—a practice the Pentagon called “wasteful and destructive.”

We're talking about the need to provide adequate disaster relief for the people of Texas, Florida, the Virgin Islands and Puerto Rico – an island where hundreds of thousands are still without electricity.
45 years after Roe v. Wade, access to safe abortion services has changed the economic futures of millions of women. #RoevWade http://time.com/5110722/elizabeth-warren-roe-v-wade-abortions/
@JulieeRoddy @SenSanders I understand your feelings. Thanks for sharing them. My best to your husband and kids.

It’s been over 100 days since protection for 800k Dreamers ended, since community health centers were funded, since hurricanes ravaged TX, FL & PR. The Republicans refused to fix any of these issues– and they still haven't fixed them. We don't need new promises. We need new laws.
Chinese Police Seize Publisher From Train in Front of Diplomats via @NYTimes https://www.nytimes.com/2018/01/22/world/asia/china-police-bookseller-train-gui-minhai.html

While conventional wisdom says China's liberalization is inevitable, White House's new Nat'l Security Strategy notes China continues to "expand its power at the expense of the sovereignty of others." We need to wake up to China's growing threat to our nat’l security & way of life
Enough is enough. The Republican Party controls the House, Senate and White House. They have got to govern, not ignore the major crises facing this country.

We 're talking about many thousands of people with disabilities who will die because they couldn't get their claims processed in a timely manner by an underfunded and understaffed Social Security Administration.

The way to end the #TrumpShutdown & solve issues that Republican leaders have been ignoring for months was to take up a bipartisan proposal on the table that Democrats, Republicans, most Americans, and the large majority of Congress supports. That wasn’t the plan voted on today.

The Majority Leader’s comments fell far short of the ironclad guarantee I needed to support a stopgap spending bill. I refuse to put the lives of nearly 700,000 young people in the hands of someone who has repeatedly gone back on his word.
